content.webTitle: British theatre stereotypes us, claim east Asian actors

fields.headline: British theatre stereotypes us, claim east Asian actors
fields.bodyText: Swimming against the tide of self-congratulation that, in the wake of a big haul at last week's Tony awards, threatens to engulf British theatre, come a number of British east Asian actors and writers concerned that directors are reluctant to cast them in anything other than stereotypical roles. "As a British Chinese actor," the performer and writer Andy Cheung told the Stage, "I feel like a black man living in the 50s." Standup comic Anna Chen said she writes her own material because "parts are not written for Chinese actresses". Having felt particularly uncomfortable watching Caucasian performers turn Japanese for The Mikado at English National Opera last year, the Diary is surely not alone in giving this pause for thought.
